The cocktail drinks were perfectly mixed and best of all, were strong (there's nothing I hate more than weak drinks!!!). We had the always tasty & fresh deviled eggs and it was great to see that they returned the Little House salad to an appetizer sized serving which is where it belongs. The staple of this place is the rotisserie chicken, and once again, it did not disappoint. The quality & quantity of the food negated the need for deserts. Although Bandera is not inexpensive, the freshness & quality of their offerings and the responsive, friendly service of the staff make it a worthwhile experience in Old Town Scottsdale. As I always say after ding at what I consider a 5-star place, we will be back!!

I finally made it back to Banderas to actually dine in the restaurant.  I am still dreaming of the macho salad... I think I am in love!  This salad is so good it has Roasted Chicken, Avocado, Chopped Dates and Goat Cheese... I cannot wait to come back.  Michael had their dinner special which was the mushroom meatloaf with mashed potatoes and spinach; I tried this also and it was so good.  I wish Bandera was open for lunch I would come here every week!

This place made my trip to Scottsdale worth it.  The rotisserie chicken is the best I've ever had.  Cooked over a wood fire made it perfect.  Rice and skillet cornbread was awesome too.  Great wine selection.  Allie at the bar was very nice and attentative.  Everything was on point, even the music.  Appropriately priced.  Would come back to Scottsdale just to eat here.

I have to give 4 stars this year. Normally love this place but my husbands Ribs were disappointing, a little tough and small. My meal was great.  I had the macho salad which was good And the corn bread was awesome as usual.

I love this chain of restaurants, and I definitely do not like chain restaurants!  everything is good here-from the service, to the martnins, to the deviled eggs, and ALL the entrees. love it! Great atmosphere too. If you're lonely, just come sit at the bar and chat it up with some new friends.

I love this restaurant!  We have been going to Bandera's for 19 years.  Always consistent, always know it will be amazing and always know the service will be top notch!!  The food is excellent and the choices are vast.  Anytime we have out of town guests, it is usually our first choice, Bandera's never disappoints.  We live in the very north valley and it's is worth the drive!  Will be returning as long as they are there! 5 STARS!!

took my dad here a few months ago i had a ribeye and he had the prime rib. freaking delicious!!! that cornbread is to DIE for! place is great, easy to park, plenty of seating, and the food is on point!!! will come back for sure!!!
First restaurant I tried in Phoenix/Scottsdale area. It was really good. The layout and atmosphere went along great with the food. Definitely would recommend this place.
Very good food and service!!! Try the honey mustard BBQ sause!!!!

One of the best margaritas in town! You can't go wrong with this old town Scottsdale restaurant. Try the little garden salad (delicious) or the famed whole chicken entree. Top off this fabulous meal with banana cream pie. Cheers!

Great ambiance, great steak, excellent service. I had the Tri-tip and Enchilada platter, while my friend had a chicken entree. My friend enjoyed her meal, and I loved the Tri-tip. However, I didn't enjoy the enchilada one bit, but I guess I just don't like butternut squash like I thought I did. The sauces on the enchilada were perfect though. As for the service, I couldn't ask for better. Polite, fast, friendly, and professional. I saw that a previous reviewer had a lot to complain about a specific server and a lot to brag about their rich friend and how they spent a whopping $105.80... big whoop. Gotta love the snotty "middle-class-millionaires" around here. Anyways, it turns out the server they're complaining about is the same server we had, Kamaili. She was excellent, and I hope we have her every time we go here in the future. She was clearly focused on making sure we were happy with our meal.
Fantastic place in Old Town Scottsdale...I just love the feel to this place - so relaxing and comfortable.  The servers are fantastic too!
Great atmosphere and food! It's setting in old town Scottsdale is awesome! I highly recommend checking this place out!
Oh my word, thank YOU Scottsdale.  Heaven in a slice of meat & potatah! Yes, I said "potatah!"   YUMM. Freakin' yumm... Good 'ol meat and potatoes.

You know that restaurant where you go to and immediately ask yourself "why don't I come here more often?", well you guessed it, it's here.   Walked in and immediately was greeted by the hostess. Great first impression. Sat down and was immediately greeted by our waitress who, if the management ever reads this, Kayla was just about everything you can ask for in a waitress. Talk about someone who made our meal an "experience". I mentioned that it was my girlfriends first time dining there, and I promise you it won't be our last. She was fan-fricken-tastic. Her recommendations were spot on, and she did everything with a smile. Huge shoutout to Kayla!!!  I guess I should mention the food now. Ribs. Get them. Fall off the bone with a BBQ mustard sauce. My mouth is literally watering writing this. Everything was taste buds bursting quality. Topped off our dinner with their banana cream pie. Save room for this dessert. You'll thank me after.  Can't wait for our next visit. We want Kayla!
Love bandera's  Excellent food service quality  Gets a bit crowded but well worth it
The filet is amazing and the service is exceptional. This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix - I highly recommend it!!
I have been to this location many times over the years and have not been disappointed. The Macho salad was delicious and the cornbread was just as good as I remember.
Bandera's Chicken Enchiladas have set the standard for me.  I doubt I will ever find a better mexican dish anywhere.  The mix of Green and Red enchilada sauce is Bomb.com/thebestieverhad

Excellent! Ambiance is great, service is top-notch and I was promised the best french dip I ever had, and they delivered! Only downside was the portioning. The sandwich was $19.00 and large enough to feed two adults. I was dining alone and traveling, so sadly had to abandon half of it. I ate at the bar, and everything I saw come out of the kitchen, looked amazing! Cannot wait to go back.

My husband and I along with our brand new baby went here Saturday night. The caliber of waitresses and waiters was superb. We were blessed to have Kylie as our waitresses. She was extremely in tune with our needs. She would walk by often just to see if we needed anything else. She was warm and friendly. She wasn't the only one - we heard a few other employees talking to other tables and they were all very professional and caring.   To make this review really stand out. I left her a huge tip. Trust me I do not leave big tips; it is rare. She truly deserved it. When I say huge tip I don't mean 30%. I'm talking more than 50%. That's how good I felt after visiting banderas.   Food: we had the rotisserie chicken and the macho salad with the chicken. We had the artichoke for an appetizer. All of the food was great!  Beer: my husband loved the frozen cups that made the beer taste fantastic!  I had to speak to the manager just to let her know I was highly impressed with her team. She explained that their hiring process was pretty intense and they want their customers to feel special so they train their employees to exceed the standards.   If you've never been to this restaurant. You must go!!!

Service was great. Good food. Strong drinks ;) Tried the deviled eggs ;) I had the ahi tuna w a great salad.  My wife ordered the chicken and ribs combo. Ribs were great. Chicken was chicken.  The tuna was sashimi style ;)
The cornbread - a must have! We had the chicken enchilada and the filet entrees. Both were outstanding. Would not hesitate to recommend, and look forward to going back!
This is hands down my favorite restaurant in town! The menu is small but everything is cooked to perfection. The Lemon drop is amazing.

I have been dining here for years.  Although the food is always tasty, the portions have gotten much smaller over time and of course prices have gone up. After my last meal there the perceived value was shattered. Tiny portions of everything from chicken to potatoes and vegies. The avocado salad was kind of a joke and certainly not shareable.   I think the wine is overpriced because they serve a 4 ounce pour and at 11 bucks, a small glass of a grocery store Chardonnay is a bit much.  Service is always predictable and by that I mean fast very fast as in eat and go please. It's rarely kind and personable but at the same time never bad, because the severs are obviously trained to turn there tables professionally.  This use to be my go to restaurant in Old town, but I find myself choosing others now. I wish Bandera was great again.

GREAT American restaurant. Has the atmosphere of a nice steakhouse, but it's menu is much more diverse. Best appetizers: the grilled artichoke and the skillet cornbread, hands down. You get a ton of food with both. I always get the burger, and it's pretty good. The fries are really thin and crispy--so thin that I didn't think I'd like them, but I did. A lot. Their rotisserie chicken is good too--you can see the chicken roasting on the spit through one of the side windows of the restaurant. The only downfall? The water glasses are really really tiny. It isn't a huge deal, but as a big water drinker, I feel bad having my server come to refill my glass 19 times throughout my meal. Good thing the service is so nice!

This was the definition of a great restaurant. I had the prime rib, which was cooked to a perfect medium rare. The service was great and would gladly go back. My only issue was the side of mashed potatoes had little to no flavor and felt they didn't belong with the wonderfully seasoned prime rib. Then the Oreo cake desert was just the perfect end to a great meal.
It was amazingThe waitress Anna was So amazing I loved the food especially the French dip

This place is just GREAT.  Have been coming here for a many years it is very well managed, the food - all of it is in some way special even the cheeseburgers are oblong very tasty and served on matching poppy seed rolls.  The roti chicken is incredible everyone at the table ate mine.  The garlic mashed potatoes- excellent, the wilted spinach - the best I have had.  Hey it's not cheap but the beers are only $5 - oh and the complimentary french bread is prepared on the grill with the grill marks in it.   Hey and the atmosphere is warm and fuzzy even if you are with 2 kids - ( oh and they loved it too)

Wow. This is all I have to say about this place. Headed down here for a early dinner. We arrived a little after 5 on a Saturday and were promptly seated. This place does seem to get busy so try to get there as early as possible if you do not want to wait.   We walked past where they were making the chicken and the smell from that alone pretty much sealed the deal as to what I was going to order. We did start off with the cornbread which was absolutely amazing. I would definitely recommend getting that as an appetizer.   We all ordered the rotisserie chicken as stated and it did not disappoint. It was so juicy and tender and the sauce that they had on it was absolutely amazing. By far the best rotisserie chicken I have had in a long long time. The green rice it came in was pretty darn good as well. After we stuffed ourselves my friends dad insisted on dessert so we got the oreo with the ice cream which did not fail to disappoint as well. In all, a great meal. I would definitely recommend this for a casual dinner out with a family or even a date.
Very good, high quality food. I just wish they seated your party even if not everyone was there.
Outstanding!!    Food - Ambiance - Service - Consistency  First thing i think about when I'm in Phoenix is Bandera's.  Everything on the menu was outstanding.  This place is the real deal.

Food was amazing, and our server, Leah, was awesome- very attentive, polite, and apparently a comedian in training! What an excellent experience, I highly recommend- and ask for Leah if you are lucky enough to dine when she is working!!
Dip duo with double cheese is my favorite, still need to try some other menu items but so far I like this place a lot. Very professional atmosphere too which I love.

Read the reviews on YELP and because we needed a restaurant within walking distance of our hotel, we decided to give it a try  We had a 2 year old and a 6 week old with us. The hostess took us to a great table.  Our waitress was excellent.  We split a sandwich and an order of the corn bread.  Delicious! And plenty of food.  We watched a guy inspect every plate and we saw him send 2 back. We asked our waitress. She said he was the GM and every plate had to be perfect before it was delivered to the table.  Ours was!  We are definitely going back!

Ceasar salad was perfect, chicken and rice was the best I have ever eaten, corn on cob with chili butter was amazing, and the homemade Oreo desert was incredible. By the way, the service was 5 star all the way. No wonder this place has a wait most every night. Wish I could eat there 8 nights a week...
GREAT food, wonderful atmosphere.  I can stand outside all day and smell those rotisserie chickens!  LOVE LOVE LOVE

Love this place. So many reviews, so I'll just give you my last week favorites . Grilled Artichokes are back:) and better than ever. Corn bread, no matter what kind of diet, this is worth a splurge, so good you can eat it without butter to feel better about yourself. Also anything chicken!!!!! Have a good time, see you there .

Let's pretend for a moment that we're bigshots! We want huge steaks, giant glasses of wine, and beautiful waitresses serving us. It's Friday night and we're getting drunk. That's the feeling at Bandera. Excess is normal and we love it!  Bandera intends to be a serious steakhouse, but they only have three steaks on the menu. That's pretty good compared to the rest of Arizona though. I ordered the fillet mignon with spiced curry powder. Perfectly cooked to my liking (medium rare), the curry powder was balanced, providing a nice zip that vanished as soon as it was detected. The grill masters really know their stuff, as the wood fire grill provides a beautiful aromatic char.  My entree came with a gargantuan piece of broccoli, fitting the theme of excess, as well as an accompaniment of shoestring fries. The fries were thin, crispy, and dainty, being the only reminder to an outside world where things aren't always super-sized. It was a great balance to everything else that evening.   Service is gorgeous and polite. At the bar, the wait staff is a bit hectic as they need to handle two types of requests at the same time. But it's forgivable and the food more than makes up for it.  Highly recommended if you're a voracious carnivore.

This was an amazing restaurant! The service was the best in the world and I'm not kidding! I am definitely going back! If you haven't went go! And if you have, go back! With amazing decor beyond great service and amazing food this restaurant is stunning!h

I'm thru with this place... How the mighty Bandera has fallen from grace... Having eaten here for many years I've witnessed the demise of a great restraunt faster than the fall of the Greek Empire.  Menu has changed  way to much over the years and the beef ribs which was worth traveling across the globe now, have left the building faster than Elvis... And if this was not enough the peanut coleslaw formula changed into an inedible mess... They've added parsley to the mix which has destroyed not only the flavor but the texture when u place a fork full into your mouth...  RIP

This place never disappoints.  I love the atmosphere and the food is always on point!  You have to start with the artichokes. Delish!  They make the perfect Kettle One Martini.  I love the Macho salad.  My husband always enjoys the rotisserie chicken and beef short rib combo. We always get an order of fry's and ask for the spicy mayo to dip them in.  The kale and peanut side salad is so amazing also.  I know, Its alot of food, but we cant resist the amazing party that takes place in your mouth.  And to end the evening, no matter how full we are, we always order the decaf freshly brewed americano coffee.  Seriously the best coffee we have ever had!  Enjoy!

My husband ,our son and our good freind Meghan from Michael Stars enjoyed a faboulous dinner .Stephan was incrediable server and he is soo very funny as bonus. We had devilled eggs and corn bread for appys then each of us had something different .my salmon was cooked perfect and apparnatly the barbecued chicken and beef ribs were out of this planet .The desert menue all be it smal was wel received  - al in all a very enjoyable evening highly reccomend for those wanting old town eating experience

Bandera is one of my all-time favorite restaurants. I have never had a single menu item I didn't like and I've been there more times than I'd care to admit. Their cornbread is To.Die.For! Their house salad is so delicious and unique- quite a surprise. And their chicken and green rice are mouthwatering and always cooked to perfection- a combo made in heaven. Can't wait for another excuse to go back.

I will start by saying that the food at Bandera is always amazing. The service has always been technically sound, but also very transactional. Let's just say they're not known for making you feel all warm and fuzzy, but the food is always great so you go back.   If you want to go somewhere to spend time with friends or guests then don't come here.   Tonight my guest and I were asked to get up from our table to make room for the other reservations. I was so horrified that a manager would even come over to request such a thing. To clarify, we asked if this was a policy and she responded that yes- after 90 minutes they ask people to get up if they've finished their meal. If I'm going to spend about $80/person on dinner then I feel like I should be able to stay and enjoy my wine or cocktail.   Hillstone, Houston's, Bandera are industry stars when it comes to polished service but what the heck was that tonight?? I couldn't even believe it, I still don't think it has sunk in. I will never spend another cent at any of your restaurants and I will definitely make sure I tell people why.   1 star for you.

This is my favorite old-stand-by in Old Town! I have never been disappointed with the meal or service.   Best bets are Rotisserie Chicken, Ceasar Salad, Prime Rib, Skillet o' Corn Bread & Oreo dessert.   Expect a lengthy wait because...your in Old Town Scottsdale at a great restaurant.

We have been going to Banderas for 15 plus years in downtown Scottsdale. We went with friends for their prime rib which we love and got there early at 6 o'clock with a party of 6 all craving prime rib. When we ordered our prime rib they informed us that they had run out. What a disappointment it was only 6 p.m. so the next best thing as they said was the chicken and ribs which we all ordered. What another disappointment. The chicken was dry and cold and the ribs were overcooked. Did this company sell out?

Every time I come to Phoenix to visit my friend over the past 4 years, I always want to eat here. It's excellent.  A chain? Not sure....  The cornbread and artichoke is excellent (the best artichoke my husband ever tried... keep in mind he's only eaten it with me).  The Cesar salad is excellent. I think they use the cornbread as croutons. Yummy!  The ribs are my favorite here. I haven't tried anything else because the above appetizers and ribs are too much food for me.  I would have given this place 5 stars BUT they CHANGED the peanut coleslaw recipe!!!   NOOO.......  I don't like cole slaw, but their peanut one was incredible. I would order extra sides of it, because it was so delicious.  I haven't been here for ~1 year, and the cole slaw turned into a salad kind of thing with peanuts sprinkled on top.  awful.... it was not very good.  What a disappointment. Don't know anyone who makes coleslaw like that. It was incredible. I wish it would come back....
This was our 4th choice in the area and stumbled across it.  By far the best meal we have had yet!! The bbq salmon is amazing!!
not my favorite bandera but i like the size and location...still no live jazz :(

This was my first time there, food was delicious and the service was amazing! Big shout out to Ruby who took such good care of us and went over the top for my boyfriend who was leaving the following day to fight wild fires for two weeks! An overall great experience!

We frequently dine at the one in Sacramento which is close to where we live and were usually not a fan of chains but this one always makes the cut. Great energy in the restaurant. Must haves are the dip duo, skillet of corn bread, caesar salad and their martinis. We've never had a bad meal at any of them. Great service too

I love to go to Bandera to start my evening off.  I've had there dinners in the past, but the most memorable food item there is their Dip Duo with Tortilla chips and their yummy Mojitos.  Bandera is a cool place to start off the night with a good appetizer and a strong drink.

Bandera is one of my Scottsdale favorites! It's got great ambiance and would recommend it for date night. It's almost always busy so I would recommend a reservation.  The best appetizer to start things off is the grilled artichokes. They come with the best dipping sauce! Brussels sprouts are also pretty good. For the entrees, it's hard to find anything that isn't delicious. I've had the macho salad, bangers and mash, prime rib, and rotisserie chicken...none will disappoint. They've got a great selection of wine and beers as well. I've only had dessert a couple of times but both were excellent. One was a nut crust pie and the other was creme br√ªl√©e. Great place and would highly recommend...make reservations though!
My favorite restaurant of all time. Absolute excellent service and the food is in incredible . The rotisserie chicken and mashed potatoes is the best Iv ever had. Highly recommend

The ambiance is top notch and the staff provided good service by being attentive.  However, I have to ding Bandera for its small portion sizes.  The food wasn't enough quantity nor high enough quality to justify the price premium.
A great location, great decor, ok food with high prices and just average service....use to love it but frankly, there are now many better choices.

We had great dinner at Bandera Saturday night.  Myself and 3 other buddies tried Bandera again.  We had ate here 10-15 years ago when it opened, and I thought it would be fun to go back and try it again.  I was really glad we made this decision.  We started with the cornbread and a rack of ribs to share between ourselves.  Now, I had been to other Hillstone restaurants and I new the cornbread would be great.  However, I had never had the ribs.  They had a good char on them and were fall off the bone tender.  They topped the ribs with a mustard BBQ sauce that was just perfect balance of sweet and savory.  I had the 'campfire' blackened ribeye.  Perfect temperature.  An interesting blackening rub gave it a sweet smokey flavor.  It needed salt and a little more 'heat' for my taste for a blackening seasoning.  My other buddies also got the rib eye or the bone in prime rib.  The prime rib looked awesome...I was a little jealous.  Two last comments:  The wine prices are more than fair...they appeared to not mark up their wine at all.  We had a bottle of the Lewis Cellars Hillstone Cab...$125.  This is what I would pay retail for it.  This was a very nice surprise.  Lastly, our server, Anna, was outstanding...dealing with our alcohol induced antics and giving us great recommendations throughout the meal.  1st class server in a great dining establishment.  The GM should be proud of what they are doing.

Wow!!! Service and food was amazing!!!! Cortney was the most friendly and welcoming bartender! Made my experience there unbelievable. The food was fantastic and will be coming back more often now. Thanks Courtney and Banderas for a great dining experience.

So my friend from Tucson said when she's in PHX she always likes to stop by at this restaurant called Bandera. She told me how good it was so I went on Yelp to do some research because I haven't heard of this place, which to me was shocking. I'm not sure how I missed this place because it's right in Old town where all the restaurants are at. O_o  So what grabbed my attention from the pictures on yelp was their Cornbread... let me just say that I LOVE good cornbread...Bandera serves their cornbread on a skillet, it came out right out of the oven, hot, fresh, crisp, and my golly it so good! (Yes, I said "Golly" lol...)  I could  taste the corn and jalapenos all together in my first bite. If anyone has tried ZTeja's skillet style cornbread, Bandera has got it in the bag! I just wanted to eat that as my main entree...it was that good...!)  I got the Prime Sirloin Tri-Tip and Enchilada Platter with cucumber salad (this seemed the be the popular choice on yelp). The portion was good, although it was plenty it wasn't too small or gigantic. Everything went well together, the sirloin was cooked to medium rare, the enchilada was delicious with the perfect amount of their special enchilada sauce that was drizzled on top, and their cucumber salad was refreshing! My bf got the Aged Prime Rib which is slow roasted on the bone with mashed potatoes. He was surprised on how big the rib was, it was literally the size of his hand haha! It was just way too much meat for him, if you like a lot of meat then this dish is for you!   So everyone said that they were full and had no room for dessert but I insisted on getting something! It was either between Banana Cream Pie or their homemade Oreo Cookie, they both looked so good but we choose the Banana Cream Pie with caramel and crushed chocolates to share and guess what...we all killed it!   I would definitely recommend this place. The ambiance was great, service was fantastic, food was good, check it out. =) I'll be back to try their Oreo Cookie Sandwich next time and of course their Cornbread.

I have the darnedest time figuring out the differences between the Hill-stone, Houston's, and this place.  Evidently some of the subtlest market positioning ever is taking place at their corporate headquarters.  Having said that, I like the place.  The cornbread is the stuff of legend, a modern day manna if you will.  Just read every other review.  Also, the way they roast their chicken is top notch.  I believe 3 of my favorite dishes there feature it.  Great American dining, even if it's hard to distinguish this place from a Houston's.

Okay, I went back to Bandera's after realizing that I missed out on the Cornbread skillet...and boy I am glad I did!!!!  The Cornbread Skillet was Heavenly SIN!!! Crunchy, creamy, so flavorful I am in LOVE!  My friend and I shared a few different items, and everything we had was top notch, not sure there is anything at Bandera's that isn't good. I find it hard to believe that a "Chain" Restaurant could have so many great dishes, but Bandera's has proven me wrong.  We also ordered the Roasted Chicken & Low Country Barbecue Beef Rib Combo with Coleslaw. The Chicken is amazingly flavorful. The Beef Ribs were fall off the bone moist. And the Coleslaw was out of this world!! Can I please have the Recipe for the Coleslaw!?!?!?  What a great Menu, not many choices but all of them great!

Banderas is as good as it gets!!!!!!!!!!! As everyone I know KNOWS (lol) I am a total "FOODIE" And have an extensive history in food and beverage. I am in love with all phases of this restaurant-The highest level of Quality, Service, Atmosphere, Cleanliness, and The highest regard for safe food handling. There managers and staff are trained to the most professional level I have ever experienced.  They are there for YOU the customer and show you as a customer how valuable you are to their business. We appreciate you Banderas and will always be loyal grateful customers! PS If there is any question to the quality or service level being less than your expectaion, they immediately rectify the issue with authentic and genuine willingness and care!

I work nearby and have always wanted to try this place out. For one, I've heard things about it and secondly I like to be able to refer my customers to restaurants nearby. However, I have to say I was very disappointed. The ambience is very nice, the service was fairly decent, but the food was terrible!! Way overpriced. I had the prime rib and thought it had no flavor to it, the raw horseradish had zero kick to it and the broccoli tasted like I was eating a tart lemon, just odd. Very disappointed!  On a side note, I work in the wine industry and thought they had an excellent wine list - which is impressive.   Overall depends what your looking for. If it's prime rib, this is definitely not the place!
Love this place! It is one of my wife's and my favorite date spots! The atmosphere is great! The food is AMAZING! Try the Salmon!

The food is delicious. The atmosphere was really cool. It's dressier than I would expect from driving by. It's really busy so make a reservation. The food is worth it. Service was good. Everything we ate was great.

I have mixed feelings about Bandera's star worthiness.  Ambiance is great, dark, romantic, great bar area..I could picture James Bond sipping on a cocktail at this bar and charming a Scottsdale woman back to his suite at the W before flying off to Casablanca to kill another villain..one star for that. That said, it gets packed, and can feel a bit claustrophobic.   Our server was wonderful. I think the true talent of a great server shows when they can handle big groups and are good with kids. I can't remember her name, but she deserves a shout out, star for that.    Now that I'm living with a famous health food chef/trainer I am lucky to experience what real quality food can taste like when prepared to perfection. Ill say the food was good, but not life changing here...so one star out of two for taste.   Why do they lose the other star you ask? Well it's always nice to have management stop by and ask how things are, it is an important part of customer service. We were celebrating a bday..and one of the attendees was in the two year old range. For the most part, behaving very well, but was occasionally letting out a giddy, happy scream, which can happen at this age especially with the excitement of helping open a few gifts for her mother.    There is the way right way to approach this situation as manager on duty, and a wrong way....The only time we saw management was when she approached the table and straight up told the group, "If the child screams one more time you are going to have to leave this restaurant"  This was after we had a half dozen appetizers on the table and waiting for our mains..Now I  certainly do not write books on the basic fundamentals of nonviolent communication, but I'm guessing this would not be in the manual.   Pissing off mamma bear is exactly the last thing you ever want to do.  A better approach may have been to start with  "Hi guys, Im so happy everyone is having a lovely time at our establishment, happy bday, and I just would like to ask you guys to try and hold, insert name of said child here, happy screams down. The pitch is rather loud and echoing across the other tables thanks again."    It certainly soured the evening and I know that it may be a long time before anyone in our group gives this place any business again.
The burgers are SOOOOO good!!! Oh, and they do take reservations which is great for the weekends in Scottsdale. And don't forget the Oreo dessert.

Cornbread alone is worth the trip, but don't stop there.  Get the chicken.  Don't think of getting anything else (at least not your first time).  Just get the chicken - it's extremely moist & deliciously simple.  Rustic modern decor with a charming waitstaff complete the package.  It makes you wonder why there aren't more restaurants doing this kind of thing.

One of our favorite restaurants in Scottsdale! It never disappoints.  Staff is always very friendly.  Drinks are great & the glasses are always cooled, which is a nice touch in this heat! Food is always superb and we have never been disappointed.  We especially love the artichoke appetizer and the rotisserie chicken is to die for.  Very tasty.  The macho salad is out of this world!  Nice and super fresh and great ingredients.

This place was recommended by our driver and we are so glad that we took his advice!  The chicken was really maybe the best I've ever had.  It was full of flavor and so moist.  I also ordered the cornbread , which I actually took the left overs home!  ( I know, I should be embarrassed, but it was THAT good!!)    I saw a gentleman with a great looking salad  that I figured had to be a specialty salad but that was not the case, it was the house salad and it was also really good.  Our bartender was  so friendly!  I cannot remember her name but she was a local  and gave us tips on places to go when we headed to the grand canyon.  ( Jerome was awesome btw, if you read this!)  I would definitely go back if I visit here again

Been in Scottsdale for less than a week and we've had to come back again to eat at this delicious restaurant. The burger here is to die for. Comes with real shoestring fries that are delicious. The artichoke and deviled eggs were also favorites.  You can tell they make all their sauces in house. We tried both desserts and they were both great but I loved the ice cream sandwich! The service was great especially our server Anna. I will definitely come back the next time we come to town!
Place is real nice and the service is good but you pay a lot for average food.  Nothing to excite you except the cornbread which is a must have.

I really like Bandera.  I really LOVE their cornbread.  Best dang cornbread I've ever had.  I dream about it in fact.  Food is always great, service is usually great as well.  Great place to take guests if you're not sure what they like.  My only complaint...Bandera is a fairly casual restaurant, yet last time I was there my father was asked to remove his cap.  No biggie, he willingly obliged, but then I noticed the staff didn't seem to have a problem with the cute little thing wearing hers at the next table.  Come on, be consistent guys.

We recently visited Bandera again thinking we might just go in for cocktails and appetizers but it was not to be.  We put our name on the wait list for a table in case the bar failed to clear out which is what happened.  We also met a local who frequents Bandera multiple times per week so through him we were able to learn more about both the restaurant, it management and corporate history which is not really important for an update.  What is important is to remember to always ask if something you want is NOT on the menu.  Good example is their incredible meat loaf which I thought was long gone.  Not so according to our new friend who not only spotted it in the open kitchen but also asked our server who confirmed that it was.  I still haven't had their renowned rotisserie chicken which is a favorite of the friend who joined us for dinner.  This restaurant never ceases to amaze me and I don't think I would ever get tired of either the food, the ambience, energy and class of this place.  It may be part of a chain but it is one hell of a good chain restaurant.  Can't wait to eat there again!

My boyfriend took me here on a date when i was visiting Arizona, this is quite possibly the best steak i have ever had. I ordered the filet...this steak is literally 2 inches thick, word to wise medium rare will be warm in the center. Green Rice sounds funny but taste fantastic. Bandera is pricey but worth it.

First time dinner. Really great service from Anna. Started with cornbread and deviled eggs. Terrific. Wife and I split the chicken and ribs. Chicken was perfectly cooked.  Ribs are beef and tasty. They come with a sweet yellow sauce.  Finished with banana cream pie. All in all, a great place to eat.

Terrible parking. Located in Old Town Scottsdale area. But the area is full of exciement and the beautiful people. Great atmosphere and simialar to J. Alexanders or Houstons. Could be same owner as one of them. Menu is simple. Food is medium to upper price and cocktails a little pricey but fits the atmosphere. I had chicken caesar and it was good but nothing special.Had appetizerof chips and cheese dip and quacamole dip which was good but only comes with minimum chips but they did bring more upon request. Probably wont go back but I can see why alot of people like it. 3+ sta and alot of good competition in the area.

This is a quiet, mellow place to have a quiet dinner with friends or your spouse. Not crazy about the staff, but they are not horrible, though. I guess, that I have experience great customer service in other places and we, as human beings, tend to compare.

Service was great and the food exceeded my expectations! I had the burger, medium rare. It was cooked to perfection. You don't need to do a thing to this burger. The slaw added a simple sweetness to it not to mention they bake the bun in house. I'd recommend the charred corn on the cob as a side.
Burger was great! I have not had a better butternut/white cheddar enchilada...service friendly and attentive!

Was in Scottsdale for work and was told to go there by a local. So glad I did. Excellent service, great atmosphere and location. Your first time there, go with the flagship chicken & ribs combo. You will not regret it. Also, get the cornbread, even if you don't like cornbread. Trust me here. Love how the entrance actually takes you first into the kitchen.

Great ambiance!  Free parking garage directly across the street. Rotisserie chicken and carnitas sandwich were so yummy and the jalapeno cornbread was great also.  Attentive servers.  Be prepared to drop some dough.

Think of Bandera like Houston's with a Southwestern flair. Well, I mean it's owned by the owners of Houston's after all, so it's not a surprise it reminds me of Houston's.   I enjoy Bandera for dinner because it's cozy inside and filled with the hustle and bustle of a busy restaurant without making it uncomfortable for customers. I like this atmosphere because we can have a nice dinner for two and be in our own element but it's not quiet either. Nothing's worse than being in a dead silent restaurant where the staff is lurking around waiting to hear your conversation.   Now moving on to the food side of the evening. I have two words: southwestern cornbread. Oh my...I could eat the entire skillet, but I contained myself and just had a corner of it. It's filled with jalapeno, and chunky corn throughout the bread. It's amazing. It's so amazing, it didn't even need butter. That's a sign of good bread. I had the crispy chicken sandwich which was delicious but ginormous.   In summary, I have Bandera on my rotation for great dinner spots when it's time to make it a night out but without making it a huge deal.

Service is pretty good, however they do group service and dont communicate so you often have to repeat yourself.   Atmosphere is warm and cozy. The largest table seats 5 so not good for groups. We came in with 8 and had to be seated at two different tables.   The food is good- I got the sweet potato enchilada and would get it again! The portions are not huge and shareable.   We had an issue where there were black specs in the water (maybe a filter issue?). At first we thought they were bugs but after asking for new water and getting it again, we realized it must've been the whole supply. They seemed too busy to really care or address this so unfortunately the 8 of us just went without water.   We aren't dying to go back, but would return sometime in the future because the food and atmosphere are great

Nice atmosphere. Tasty, unique menu. Great food. Great service- fast, personable, plentiful service   We had the duo dip nachos - that cheese dip is AMAZING.  We also ordered grilled artichokes as an appetizer. I had the tri tip beef & enchilada plate with a lovely chilled vegetable salad.  We also ordered the  prime rib dinner. Everything was delicious and I would recommend this place to anyone!  The i my downside was the cost.  It's not cheap ... But depending on the occasion, completely worth it.

Started off with the skillet cornbread and the grilled artichokes for appetizers. Both were unbelievably good. The grilled artichokes were just short of a spiritual experience! I could almost hear an angelic choir hit the high notes after my first bite.   For the main courses, we ordered the Kobe beef tips and the grilled salmon. The beef tips were the clear winner, tender, cooked to perfection, and with a nice wood-grilled flavor. The salmon was good, but the "green rice" that came along side of it was a little on the tangy side for me. The salmon had a sweet glaze over the top which was good, but I guess I was not in the mood for that flavor.   The bottom line is, the Yelpers were right again. This place is a winner. You won't be disappointed.
Great experience all around. I love the Macho salad  and grilled artichokes. Don't even hesitate for a second. Make reservations.

OK, I never thought I'd be giving Bandera less than 4 stars, but here I am. We visit this location every year when we are in town, and this might be our last time. Our favorites are the Macho salad and cornbread (tho ribs and chicken are outstanding as well). We had a small takeout order one night, and I was shocked at the pricetag ... $17 for my salad ... WHAT? The cornbread seemed to have shrunk as well (though still more than enough) - and it didn't taste as good as it has in years past. Maybe just our order, but on top of my million dollar salad, it added to the disappointment.  Still good food, but with price increases, there are so many other great places in the area, we will now be checking them out vs. coming here next time ...  Thanks for the memories ....

Love this place! I've been eating here for more than 20 years and am never disappointed! The atmosphere is so posh but mellow. It has such an elegant vibe. The Oreo dessert is one of the best desserts in town. The fresh crispy Cole slaw is bright and creamy at once.
Food ,atmosphere, drinks were all great everyone was super friendly . felt the wait was a little long other than that I'll be back . price ehhh fair . over all a good job

Phenomenal service by Sarah, she is a class act among servers! I had seasonal vegetable plate with wilted spinach, peppers, tomatoes, delicious caramelized carrots and a grilled artichoke that picked up the smoky delicious flavor from the grill. Boyfriend had the ribs, which fell off the bone into succulent pieces of perfection. He even enjoyed the cole slaw which is a dish he usually detests! Topped it all off with banana cream pie. This pie has the perfect amount of chocolate shavings and caramel sauce all atop a walnut-Graham cracker crust. Swoon. Highly recommend and we will certainly be back!

Rotisserie chicken was fantastic. Super juicy and great flavor. The Brussel Sprouts are a must try item, with a great aioli type sauce. When we asked the waitress what was in the sauce she immediately told us and it had about 8 different ingredients, which explains why it had such a complex flavor. Oh, also get the kale salad. Just do it. It is phenomenal with crushed cashews creating a crunchy texture and delicious flavor!  I shared two entree items with a friend so we had the rotisserie chicken and prime rib cooked medium rare. The prime rib was bone-in and was huge!  The meat against the bone was delicious, but the rest of it was pretty standard for prime rib.

Honestly just not that great.  The smell of the place (smokey) was amazing so I was excited to see what they would whip up.  Menu looked promising.  Then the service, and don't get me wrong this will not be another "the service sucks so 2 stars" review.  Not only was the service just ok, but they were out of grapefruit juice, they did not have a certain type of dressing listed and out of prime rib. The prime rib I get, but the other stuff ....amateur hour.  The server was not very attentive and did not have any energy or personality.  The food, I had the ribs and chicken combo... the ribs were WAY to dry and the sauce was, I don't even know what that was but it was not good.  The chicken was ok nothing to write home about but it was smokey which was nice.  Over just a very underwhelming experience.  If you want good smoke house or good prime rib experience go to Bootleggers across the street.

Jalapeno cornbread....yummmmmy.   Known for rotiserrie chicken and it is quite good and so is the rest of the menu.  I could get full on the cornbread and be fat and happy and ready to go.  There usually tends to be a wait on the weekends and last time we learned that no hats were allowed in the dining room.  A little stiff for a rotiserrie restaurant but it is still delish.

Hey, not every place has to be The French Laundry.  Everyone needs restaurants in their little black book that are just always a solid experience.  Bandera reminds me of Houstons (same owners?) and has a gorgeous layout and open kitchen that give the place a great energy.  Their specials are well rounded for the fish lovers, just in case someone doesn't want a big slab of moo, and their appetizers are good enough to have just as the meal.  Desserts are straight-forward and well executed.  Round that out with a decent wine list (a lot of the wines are by the glass, which is HUGE) and a full bar that knows how to do your drink and you have a bar that gets a "solid" rating.    It's location makes it easy to walk to quite a few other restaurants or bars and of course downtown Scottsdale and "The Waterfront"  are one of the best places to hang out in America for the evening.

Good not great.  The place reminds me of Houstons back when there was a Houston's on Camelback.  I will say however that a few things are really great.  The Mac and Cheese comes in a delicious sauce that is rich and savory.  Crunch is provided by some bread crumbs and toasted walnuts.   A different take on Mac and Cheese that didn't involve Bacon which was nice. The skillet cornbread is a must have.  Sweet, crunchy with a few corn corners.  Not too dry and just dense enough.  I almost stabbed a fellow dining companion when they didn't give me a large enough wedge. The entrees are good, but not great.  Apparently the lamb steak was cooked beautifully, but just had no seasoning.  My carnitas burger was good but didn't taste of much unless I doused it with sauce.  The french fries are super skinny and good.  The roasted chicken is a safe bet.  I think the prices are about 2 dollars over what I would pay for this type of food.  But for a nice meal in Old Town, the place really is easy to slip into, it feels a little more "adult" and doesn't scream I'm in Old Town, so those are huge pluses.

Another fantastic dining experience.  Raina was our waitress and was welcoming from the start and very helpful with the menu choices.  I had the ribeye and it was seasoned with just a hint of Cajun spices and cooked to perfection...yum!  My wife had the rotisserie chicken kale salad and our friend had the BBQ rib and chicken combo...all were excellent.  I recommend The Prisoner wine, great with many dishes.  Quickly becoming one of our favorites in Old Town!  Make a reservation,  the place is busy.

Went there tonight with family. The 6 of us really enjoyed our meals and we each had different dishes. We ordered a cornbread for the table that was delicious. It was sweet and savory and dissappeared quickly! Service was excellent and it was very busy. This restaurant is a solid place with a good buzz. Would recommend it, but definitely call for reservations, as it is not a very large place.

The rotisserie chicken was so moist and tender!  The atmosphere is comfortable and upscale.  It was busy but not too loud for a quiet conversation.  Our server was knowledgable about the menu and friendly.  Nothing about this dining experience knocked my socks off, but overall it was really good.

I'm going to go ahead and give this place 5 stars... it was damn good!  I seriously couldn't stop eating... and lets just say I learned my lesson about over-indulging!  I was lucky enough to be invited here by a friend who's date was very food knowledgeable.... he's been in the industry for years.  So he took the liberty of ordering for us which I don't mind at all.    For starters we had the cornbread... Delicious.  It was so crusty and yummy on top and tender with a nice crumb in the middle... it had cheese corn and peppers in it and I thought it was great... def try it!  Next we had the deviled eggs... FRESH and delicious, and I'm not a huge fan of these unless my mom or gram makes them.  These had celery in them just like my mom/grams and they were perfect.  I would order this again.  Finally we had the guacamole, also very fresh.  This had corn kernels in it as well and I just loved the texture it brought to it.  The chips were house made, and NOT GREASY AT ALL... YUM!  you should have seen the chunks of avacado in this!  Beautiful.  I ordered the filet with mashed potatoes and broccoli.  Our friend recommended I order it Philly style (at least I think that's what he said) which is charred on the outside and I always order my meat rare... LOL and of course the other girls at the table had to let out their "EEEEEEEW"'s!  I'm not sorry, that's how I LOVE my meat, RAW :)  This was probably one of the best steaks I've ever had... Just perfectly cooked, almost purple in the middle.  Apparently their meat in the best of the best, Prime Prime, not just one Prime but TWO!  Not a drop of blood on the plate, which means they rested it.  The mash was delicious as well... and the broccoli was wonderful and buttery.  My friend ordered the ribs and they were tender and sweet and just mmmmm... if you love ribs you shouldn't pass these up!  She is not a big eater and she finished the whole slab!      I almost ate all of it I'm such a pig.  I just couldn't stop eating!  But I did save room for one or two bites of the banana cream pie (my favorite!) the table shared... and it was great... I would've eaten more but I was STUFFED to the gills!  They also ordered this oreo ice cream dessert but I simply couldn't fit in another bite.  I almost forgot... I had two (the second one was ordered for me against my will) lemon drop martini's and they were very delicious but VERY strong... jeez I didn't know what hit me!  I tasted my friends' Cosmo and it was very good as well... apparently they are famous for these two cocktails.  I would go back here every week if I could!!!  Its just that good.  I'll be thinking about this meal for a while!

So glad to have discovered this place on our trip to Spring Training! Come to find out it's in the same restaurant group as one of our favorite CA restaurants (Rutherford Grill).    Food - Amazingly delicious Service - both times we visited during this one trip the service was top notch   Highly recommend reservations unless you don't mind waiting. Even if you have to wait it's well worth it.

Hands down some of the best food I have had in a longggg time. Service was great, staff was friendly. Used the open table feature and we had a nice quiet booth waiting for us upon arrival (even though they were rather busy).  Price is okay, but you get what you pay for here.   Will definitely be back

Guys, get the cornbread skillet!! It is so awesome and the most memorable thing about a meal that was already great! We ate half as a starter along with the nice little house salad, and took the rest to go (ended up as a nice dessert later that night.   Also for dinner, we had the chicken, which was moist and tender, and the butternut squash enchilada, which came with a spicy glaze and was just unique and delicious! My companion says the enchilada was the highlight. Both were great and came with a tasty green chile rice.  Overall experience was great, too. We had early dinner reservations (5pm Saturday) prior to our evening plans and were seated promptly. Others without reservations seemed to be seated no problem either, though the place seemed to be getting pretty full. The wood fired menu options, tasty food, and great service made this one a winner!

Everything is good but it's too pricey.   I had their signature rotisserie chicken. It's very good but I only got two legs and a large glob of mashed potatoes; $19 for that. The chicken was wonderful but for that price I could have so much more and almost as good at Pollo Loco.   The cornbread is outstanding. Draft beer selection was not impressive.   The restaurant has a very nice neighborhood restaurant ambiance.  If I ever go back I might try their wood fired beef ribs because they look tantalizing.

The food was great but the service and the atmosphere was not so good. The roasted chicken and beef ribs were excellent but I give this place a 3 star because the service was not good and the people that were there were drunk or just liked to stare at other people.

There are way to many amazing places to go to Bandera.  When calling in to make a reservation I was informed "they don't do that" when asked what their corkage fee was.  The place had a normal busy Saturday night crowd but it seemed there staff was not trained for that.  We had multiple servers where we had to ask for menu's, silverware, drinks & plates. At one point even stopping a cook.  The food was ehh and no I would not go back.  Because like I said before there are way to many amazing places in the valley to go here.

Experience started off awesome! The margarita was fresh squeezed and delicious . We got there early and decided to eat at the bar. We have been to Bandera's many times and  enjoy the entire experience.  We had the opportunity to talk to the General Manager Sarah. You can be sure they care about their customers! We look forward to going back!

I came to Bandera for a double date, and overall we had a pretty pleasant experience.  I booked a reservation for 6:00 on a Saturday night.  When we arrived we had to wait 20 minutes before we were seated, even though we had a reservation.  That was a bit annoying.  Once we were seated everything went well.  The service was friendly but our server was a bit awkward. The food really was very impressive.  The cornbread was made fresh and had incredible texture and taste.  All of us sampled each others plates and agreed that everything was really great.    I like Bandera but feel like they are a bit overpriced; I'll probably come again but only for a special occasion.

We are big fans of the stone hill group of restaurants.  Bandera had great food, however the staff was a bit rushed compared to other establishments.  Typically the service is so much better.  It could have been that it was a Friday evening and there was a long wait.  I would avoid this location during busy times.

Wow. I don't know what the heck happened to Bandera. This has been our absolute favorite restaurant for many years and we've always raved about the prime rib to everyone. We took some friends out for dinner for a special occasion and arrived there early since it's usually busy on Saturday nights. We were surprised to find that it was not busy at all and we were seated right away. We ordered at 6pm and 30 minutes later the server came back to apologize that they only had one prime rib left (all 4 of us ordered the prime rib). That has never happened to us before and we usually go for much later dinners. So disappointing. But we ordered rib-eyes instead. 15 minutes later they came back to say they were out of rib-eyes as well. When we finally got meals well over an hour after we ordered, my prime rib was WAY over cooked. I ordered it medium and it was definitely well done but since it was the last one there was nothing that could be done. They offered to bring me another dish but I didn't want to wait any longer. The prime rib was also tiny compared to what they used to serve. I would write this one night off as a fluke but they replaced their AMAZING mashed potatoes with a pathetic little smear of what seemed like mashed potatoes out of a box. I gave this review 2 stars because the server and manager were very gracious and comped most of our bill. I don't know what changed but I will really miss the flawless food and service of the old Bandera. I guess all things must come to an end. Sad.

I went to Bandera when I first moved to AZ a few times and enjoyed it... and then a few years passed and I didn't really think about it.  But then all of a sudden, Bandera was on my mind.  I needed to go back!  Perhaps I was craving that cornbread or that warm atmosphere that I remembered, but for the past few weeks, I've been suggesting Bandera to whomever I'm eating with so I could return.  I saw Bandera at Noche De Gourmet, and that just put it in my head even more.  So finally, this past Sunday night, I convinced my dining companions to go to Bandera!  It was around 7:30pm... it was me, Jared, my parents, and Joan M (my mother-in-law).  We'd all worked up an appetite watching my brother complete in IronmanAZ.  We arrived at Bandera and luckily, there was no wait.  I ordered the cornbread and grilled artichoke as appetizers for the table.  A few of us enjoyed a bottle of wine.  Our server was really sweet although perhaps a bit annoyed when my dad attempted to special order the sides that came with his fish.  My mom had the meatloaf, I had the Macho Salad, J had the rotisserie chicken, and Joan had a Caesar Salad and side of brussel sprouts.  While I really enjoyed the appetizers and wine, my meal was not all that... On the menu, the Macho Salad is described "with Roasted Chicken, Avocado, Chopped Almonds and Goat Cheese." I ordered it without the almonds but it had some other surprises in there as well including cornbread croutons and dates.  Don't get me wrong - i like those things but I also like to know ahead of time what I'm getting!  The salad was huge and could've easily fed two of us.  Everyone else seemed satisfied with their meals.  I know a lot of people compare Bandera to Houston's (and they are both under the Hillstone Restaurant Group umbrella), but I have to say, I think the food at Houston's is much better!  I will no longer be craving Bandera's food... but perhaps I'll return for just their cornbread!

I've never been to the California location but I've actually been to Houston's many times which is owned by the same company my only complaint was I ordered a hamburger medium well and it came out medium rare they did take it off the bill but honestly by that point I just really wasn't hungry anymore I also ordered their cornbread and I don't feel it was as good as the other places that I've had it I think it must have been made to because literally it came to our table within minutes of ordering it and it wasn't really that hot all in all it was still on my birthday dinner from my girlfriend the manager came out and apologize for my hamburger and offered us dessert and then charges for it what do you do
I just ate at the Scottsdale Bandera. The cornbread and artichokes were superlative. My chicken was wet, pink, and bloody in the middle. I'm home now praying I don't get salmonella.

Love this place. Need to review though because I feel it has gone down hill. I have been coming to AZ yearly for 12 years and always come here. The food and atmosphere are top notch, but if an broke don't fix it. Recipes going down hill when changed.  Also, first time with two small children at the restaurant and it's not very child friendly for obvious reasons.

The food is so good. Even when you're full you keep eating. The chicken and ribs come right off the bone.   I've been here easily 10 times and am not disappointed yet. Definitely recommend the jalape√±o cornbread, Brussels sprouts, and the cold avocado/cauliflower salad.   The fresh made lemonade at the bar is bomb too. It's legit almost so sour and not enough sweet.    Xoxox  Fiona

We called for reservations but were told the earliest would be 8:00.  Since we had not eaten lunch and our body clocks were 2 hours ahead we knew we couldn't wait that long.  We were told we could come and walk in and see what happened. Decided to take a chance and am I ever glad we did.  Upon arrival we went straight to a table.  Anna was our server and guided us well!  We were delighted that the grilled artichoke appetizer was available.  Delectable...savored every delicious bite.  Husband ordered mushroom meatloaf which was generous.  I had the BBQ salmon, cucumber salad and substituted braised red cabbage with goat cheese for the mashed potatoes.  I can't remember the last time we had such a wonderful and different meal.  We ordered their banana pie to go.  When our bill came they had comped the appetizer since it was our first time there and our first artichokes.  The service was outstanding as was the food and the ambience.  What a Tuesday treat we will long remember!  Special is an understatement.

If you're looking for a great place in Scottsdale, with amazing service and more than amazing food you definitely need to check out Banderas! I have never eaten the same thing twice and have loved every single thing I've had! I have on the other hand frequently ordered the mi sueno wine, which is UNBELIEVABLE.  The team there is just BEYOND top notch, I can't say enough about Ana who was just the sweetest most attentive waitress. My girlfriends and I will take off from Chandler for an evening out at  Banderas every chance we get. It's worth every single penny and then some. The quality of everything that comes to your table is unvelieable. Compliments to the chef and team!

We went to Bandera last night.  We have been to Bandera many times over the years and had always been very pleased.  Last night, though everything about our opinions changed.  From the moment we received our Duo Dip appetizer our meals were terrible. The Duo Dip portions were barely enough for one person, let alone enough to share!   We ordered the rotisserie chicken like we always do.  Last night the chicken portions were so small we were wondering where they found such small pieces!   In addition to the small pieces, they did not even taste fresh.  They tasted more like old chicken  that had been reheated.  They have also started putting some kind of spicy pepper sauce on the chicken, which totally destroys the flavor!   Needless to say, we don't be going back to Bandera anytime soon!

We heard great things about Bandera, and had to try it.  I have to say, the pork ribs outdid the chicken (although it was very tender and tasty).  Our source said the meat would fall off the bones, and it did!  You must order the cornbread, but expect it to be a little on the sweet side.  We loved all the sides, and the oreo ice cream sandwiches were fantastic.  We had a reservation, but did have to wait another 15 minutes, which was a bummer.  The staff was very professional and pleasant, and they accommodated our 11-month old with no hesitation.

Fun intimate environment and delicious food! Would recommend the deviled eggs and skillet cornbread for starters and the rotisserie chicken is so moist and yummy!! Perfectly seasoned! Salmon is also good and so is the enchilada dish!

Made our annual pilgrimage to Banderas last night and was not disappointed. Getting there when they open at 5, which is the key to no wait for a table, allowed us to be seated immediately. Service was good & food was great. Artichokes, cornbread & margaritas are musts!

After watching the most amazing sunset at South Mountain Summit I headed back to Scottsdale and stopped here for dinner. Sat at the bar and had a ice cold beer served in an ice cold glass. The butternut and white cheese enchiladas were absolutely amazing and the cucumber salad that accompanies it was very refreshing. Vanessa the bartender was very attentive. It was a perfect end to a perfect evening!!

Let's start out with the positive. Yes, the food is amazing! Ok...that's it. DO NOT bring your kids here. I'm in town from Orange County for a girls weekend with my 2 daughters and mother. The fact that there's NO kids menu WAS the problem until the server had the audacity to bring my 5 year old a scorching hot plate, sit it right in front of her without...I don't know...a THOUGHT...or common sense absolutely blows my mind. My mom went to move it quickly, burning her hand. The server then had an amazing thought to send her less than stellar manager over who let the first thing out of her mouth be "I didn't know the plate was for a child" again common sense or even clear thought processing was lacking! Needless to say, our entire meal was comped (thank you) but not before I made sure to make the manager aware that she's very lucky it was my mother (sorry love ya mom) and not my 5 year old who burned her hand or it would've been MUCH more than a comped meal.

I would be a regular at bandera if we lived in Scottsdale!  The food was excellent and the environment was great.  Just the right amount of busy and activity on a Tuesday night.   We shared the cornbread and salad and they were good.  The rib and chicken platter exceeded my expectations.  The ribs had a sauce that took them to the next level and the chicken is not your grocery rotisserie!  It was so flavorful and moist.  The mashed potatoes were creamy and light.  We shared the banana creme pie.  Every bite was better than the next.  The portions are generous so perfect to share or take home and great value for the price.  All of the above and 3 beers and 2 margaritas was $100.
Great all around restaurant. Food was amazing, service amazing. Very well run. Artichoke and cornbread out of this world

Great dinner with my brother, his wife and son.  We received excellent service from Emilee.  She provided descriptions of the menu that were spot on.  The front end manager Leli stopped by and made sure that everything was up to Hillstone quality.  We started with the cooked artichoke for a table app that was delicious and more than enough for our party.  Entrees included ribs, ribeye, bangers and mash, and a hamburger.  The ribs were meaty, tender, and juicy.  For desert we ordered the Oreo ice cream sandwiches and banana cream pie.  The desserts  were made from scratch and not to be missed.  Bandera is now on the top of my list while in Scottsdale.

Very rude management .  Temperature is in the 50's. Came in with my fianc√© to have dinner and was told that you could sit at the bar but not at the dining room in a fairly empty Resturant because he was wearing a beanie and they had a dress code that said men could not wear hats. The bar and restaurant are all in the same area and not separated. This chain has lost it's mind . Between me and my fianc√© we were probably wearing a half a million dollars in jewelry not trying to be pretentious but we eat out 6 nights a week and they lost a good customer.
Good food, long. wait even with reservations,  What's the point in making reservations if I have to wait for an hour to get in???

Great place to have a nice meal, in a great atmosphere with the significant other, or a group of friends. Visited on New Years Eve and had a great experience. Party of 8 on New Years Eve is no small job, but they got us sat in 30 minutes and the service was consistent with the busy vibe. Everyone enjoyed their selections and even when my food came out late, they were quick to comp the entire meal. Now thats what I call customer service.  Been here  a few times and will be back.
There's not too many places that compliments each other from the facility to the services music and attention to detail.  And then comes the food pretty amazing. VERY GOOD JOB!!!!

We eat at Bandera just about every time we are in Scottsdale - I had the ribs for the first time last night and they were so good I'd go back tonight just to have them again.  Had the kale salad along with it - it was a perfect combo - so delicious! The service is always consistently good and I love the atmosphere - dark and comfy.
The beef ribs are to die for!! Prisoner wine by the glass was fair price.  French dip is always on point.  Kale salad was yummy.  Ribs, ribs just get the ribs!

BEST BURGER EVER!! they make everything at the restaurant so it's fresh and delicious!! the show strong fries are crispy and thin! the service is excellent and the vibe is rockin!! definitely try the artichoke when it's in season!
This was a well run restaurant with delicious food and top notch service. I just wish I had been more adventurous when ordering. I played it safe with Chicken when I should have gone for the Lamb.

I came here with a group of hungry guys after the Jackson Barrett car show. Throwing down the booze, eating a ton of food and chatting the night away. They've got a great selection of liquor and that includes my Malibu. Thank you!!  We got a corner booth on a Saturday night (9ish) with no reservation... although we did have to wait about 20 minutes for whatever reason.   Started with the obligatory cornbread. Ya. It's good... and really filling especially when you order a slab of meat for the entree. They know how to cook a medium rare which is always good in my book.   Decor is dark and old Hollywood with a modern flair. Kind of like you are having some clandestine affair-type meeting place. I dig it!

Tonight I had an excellent meal at Bandera.The jalapeo queso dip appetizer was quite tasty.  My rotisserie chicken sandwich was the best chicken sandwich I've ever eaten. The chicken was tender, the cheese was melted yet still flavorful and the bun complemented the flavors as opposed to just being filler.  It was my first time visiting the restaurant and I was unaware that it was part of a chain. I think that speaks volumes about the establishment right there. I'm rating Bandera four stars instead of five because the prices were rather high for the size of the portions. That being said, the portions were what I would call "a good size" compared to say, Claim Jumper which has portions that are too large. Further, I think that Bandera could use a larger selection of beers and mixed drinks.   Bandera was packed, something that surprised me for a Thursday night, and while I was able to get a table for two almost immediately, the background din made it difficult to hold a conversation or even clearly hear the server. I enjoyed the darker candle and track-lighting lit atmosphere, but it might be a turn off for some.  I'm definitely going back to Bandera, but next time I'll be prepared and not wear a ball cap, as they aren't allowed in the dining room. ;-)

This was my first visit to Bandera.  The restaurant actually took reservations, which was nice since we had a party of 6.  We approximately 15 minutes before getting seated.  I had the rib and chicken combo.  The chicken was slightly overcooked, which I have found is a common problem.  The ribs were tasty but definitely no where near real smoked ribs like you would get in Memphis.  Overall the service was great, the atmosphere nice and the food good.
Great Service every time I'm in her thanks to my server Serena. There's  always a line to get in but it's well worth the wait
Amazing food, great service.  I can always count on the macho salad AND the chicken and ribs combo dinner for a delicious meal.

I've been to Hillstone, Houston's, Rutherford Grill, Los Altos grill and now Bandera. Consistently great service everywhere, including this location. Pretty much everything on the menu is solid. Nothing mind blowing, but it's a very reliable upscale dinner spot. Highly recommend the smoked salmon appetizer. Make sure to swap out your sides if you don't like what your main course comes with. The wine list is fantastic too with very little price markup (compare to Total Wine prices to get an idea). Hillstone group is the Lexus of "chain" restaurants.

What a great intimate place for a date night or dinner with a few friends. Bandera is a small cozy establishment with a bustling crowd. I'm not sure, but I didn't see any big tables to accommodate more a bigger group (8+). All the booths on the side seem like they were meant to hold 6 people max. Anyways, the place we actually ended up sitting in the bar area b/c a spot opened up fairly quick after we got a few cocktails. (20mins at opposed to waiting for 40 mins for a table).   The drinks we got were strong and pretty good. I wouldn't say it's a place to go for cocktails since I've had better ones at speakeasy type bars. However, they do have a pretty good and unique in house selection of cocktails like the alcoholic tea.   The food was amazing. This was the best part of coming to Bandera. We started off with the skillet cornbread which was sweet, savory, and had the right texture. Will definitely recommend it to anyone coming here. Then we shared the enchiladas and the macho salad with rotisserie chicken. Both are very very good as well. Portions are huge too, so sharing is encouraged.   The service i thought was top notch. Everyone was very friendly and the food came out super fast! I was almost surprised by how fast the food was coming out and they were all at the right temperature and no undercooked dishes.   Overall, i would love to go back and try out different items.   Tip would be to make a reservation if possible since there is a huge crowd waiting outside and most times the wait could be 40+ if not longer. Or you can just wait around the bar and wait for a spot to open up!

What great food & service. Started with Corn Bread & grilled Artichoke.  Corn Bread is out of this world. Grilled Salmon was melt in your mouth, served with Mash Potatoes and Broccoli.  Could not ask for a better meal. Wife had Flying Tuna platter  - words cannot describe the flavors.  Must Try.  Ask for Megan as your waitress. She was just awesome.

This is my go to place in old town Scottsdale. Everything on the menu is going well. My favorites or smoke salmon appetizer, the enchilada, and the cornbread.The staff is amazing, he's always very consistent and very good

Like every HRG restaurant that I've been too, this one lives up to the high standard that Hillstone has set.  With a more southwestern feel but the traditional high quality and short menu, Bandera does not disappoint.    The outdoor chicken rotisserie is an awesome touch to the already classy decor and the center focus bar makes one heck of a signature margarita.  The wine list literally doesn't have any bad choices on it especially when paired with their duo dip.  When in Scottsdale this is a stop worth making...twice.

Never dissapointed here, best cornbread. Houstons and Bandera's is THE place to go for artichokes, the best, mesquite grilled. Chicken is excellent. Artichokes were out of season on a recent visit, but generally available and were on our last recent visit.

I don't feel like I use the word "succulent" often enough in day-to-day conversation. I use it to describe Bandera.   First off, I didn't even know it was a chain. And I say to that, whatever, it's a damn fine chain from what I can tell, so keep it up Bandera!  Last time I was here I had the salmon special and it was delicious, while my girlfriend nibbled on a salad that she was so-so about. The appetizers are good and the service was pleasant, and I will have to wait to try a dessert till next time. Which hopefully is soon.

Best dinner night In Scottsdale. Sat at the bar and witnessed the true art of mixology! Watched over the kitchen, perfection of sending out the dishes, garnished and wiped down plate edges.  Most impressed

Nice atmosphere and attentive staff. Yet after finding this restaurant under "Steakhouses" I was disappointed to learn that there was only one on the menu--for $29!  A little pricey....Also surprised that a prime dip wasn't on the menu. The wine list was limited and quite pricey, although the tempranillo was perfectly smooth and very addicting.    The crispy cornbread was excellent and the Bandera chicken sandwich was delectable. The roasted peppers I had as a side were a bit oily for my liking.   I'll definitely be back. The atmosphere is perfect for anything from a date to a family dinner, drinks or even a solo meal at the bar.

This is one of my favorite places in Old Town. When I first moved to Scottsdale, I ate here every night as I was staying in a hotel right in Old Town. The waitstaff and the bartenders are all so friendly, they make you feel right at home. Whenever my friends came to visit me, it was always our first stop after I picked them up at the airport. I love, love, love their grilled artichoke appetizer! I think it is one of the best in town and is served with their delicious creamy dipping sauce.  Their rotisserie chicken is delicious and my favorite entree on their menu is their grilled bbq salmon which is cooked perfectly tender and melts in your mouth!  Their mashed potatoes are also excellent and served with chives, and their corn bread is also delicious!  If you have room for desert, their banana cream pie is heavenly!

Is this the best restaurant in Olde Town?  Maybe.  Great service, beautiful ambience.  Great place for a date.  Rotiserrie chicken with the rice is my favorite dish. It is just so damm good.  Not over expensive either.  Great deserts as well.  Guys who read this take a date their.  You wont be sorry.

Our server Sarah Jean was fantastic. She spent the right amount of time explaining the menu. She took our starters order and then let us enjoy. Upgraded our wine and then ordered our entrees. Perfect service. Will be back.

The Ahi Tuna is best tuna we have ever had!! Cooked to perfection and the dressing on the greens was perfect! Rotisserie chicken is excellent! And the green rice was a great pairing. The service was excellent as well. Our 20 minute wait ended up being less than 10. Excellent cocktails. I would recommend this place for a nice evening out with friends, date night, or just for drinks. Everyone down to the kitchen staff was out together!

I love their food but their soda system is ridiculous.  When everyone is giving unlimited refills they decide to charge you $2.50 for each little 8 oz bottle of coke.  I don't drink so i love to have a coke with my dinner. The waitress tried to make it sound better by telling us the bottles were cute and we could save them as a souvenir.  Well I don't think people going to Banderas are the type  to display coke bottles in their living room.  So I spent 10 bucks on soda that night.  Even at $3 a soda they are making bank.  I think they are trying to be trendy and different but this just ends up being stupid.  Talk about being out of touch they probably still use a typewriter to type the menu.  Save some money and aggravation and go to Roaring Fork where they will refill your coke all day long for one reasonable price.

Just a fun place to dine. We asked if the chef could prepare us a chicken enchilada since it was no longer on the menu. Not a problem. That's the way a restaurant should handle a customer request. To have an experience with the locals, dine at the bar.
